questions.question: Initially, a radioactive sample contains $!$1000$!$ nuclides. The half-life of the sample is $!$50 s$!$. Find the number of nuclides after $!$100 s$!$.
A radioactive element $!$^{2}_{4}X$!$ has a rest mass of $!$4.002603 u$!$. Assuming that the rest mass of a proton and a neutron is $!$1 u$!$, find the energy needed to separate the nucleons of X.
Uranium-238 ($!$^{92}_{238}U$!$) undergoes $!$\alpha$!$ decay followed by $!$\beta^-$!$ decay to form element Y. What is the number of protons in element Y?
